goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x01: Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire
goldenage.description: Homer's Christmas bonus is canceled and the rainy-day funds are needed to pay for Bart's tattoo removal in the first full-length episode of the subversive animated satire about Springfield's hapless first family.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x02: Bart the Genius
goldenage.description: Bart is moved to a school for the gifted after he switches aptitude tests with another boy.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x03: Homer's Odyssey
goldenage.description: After being fired from the nuclear power plant for negligence, Homer becomes a safety activist.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x04: There's No Disgrace Like Home
goldenage.description: After seeing families being nice to each other at a company picnic, Homer orders the Simpsons to a family therapist.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x05: Bart the General
goldenage.description: Terrorized by the school bully, Bart seeks counsel from Grandpa Simpson, who takes him to a warfare expert for basic training.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x06: Moaning Lisa
goldenage.description: The meaning of life and second grade have Lisa playing the blues solo---until she jams with a kindred spirit; Homer seeks tutelage to beat Bart at video boxing.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x07: The Call of the Simpsons
goldenage.description: The Simpsons put the wild back in the wilderness when their RV goes over a cliff and Homer and Bart go for help, get lost and lose their clothes.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x08: The Telltale Head
goldenage.description: Bart pulls a stunt that shocks the entire town, including the new friends he was trying to impress.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x09: Life on the Fast Lane
goldenage.description: Homer's bowling-ball gift "for Marge" prompts her to take up the sport---and maybe also a handsome instructor who offers to teach her "many things."

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x10: Homer's Night Out
goldenage.description: Shutterbug Bart captures Homer with a sexy entertainer at a bachelor party.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x11: The Crepes of Wrath
goldenage.description: A little story about how Bart saves France after blowing up Principal Skinner's mom with a cherry bomb. A Albanian child comes to stay with the Simpsons in his place and becomes Homers tag along buddy.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x12: Krusty Gets Busted
goldenage.description: Bart's TV hero Krusty the Clown is arrested for a convenience-store robbery, and witness Homer must testify against the clown.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 1x13: Some Enchanted Evening
goldenage.description: Homer takes Marge out for a romantic night, leaving the kids with a sitter---who's profiled on "America's Most Armed and Dangerous."

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x01: Bart Gets an F
goldenage.description: In exchange for study tips, Bart gives the class brain anti-geek lessons, but regrets it when the brain becomes too Bart-like. Blackboard: 'I will not encourage others to fly'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x02: Simpson and Delilah
goldenage.description: Homer lies on a medical insurance form in order to obtain a miracle hair restoring drug. Blackboard: 'Tar is not a plaything.'

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x03: Treehouse of Horror
goldenage.description: Halloween tales include a family in a haunted house; a misunderstanding with aliens; and a rendition of "The Raven."

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x04: Two Cars in Every Garage and Three Eyes on Every Fish
goldenage.description: Homer's boss, Burns, wants to be governor to lower nuclear-safety standards to keep his plant on line. Blackboard 'I will not Xerox my Butt'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x05: Dancin' Homer
goldenage.description: Homer's success as the mascot of Springfield's minor-league ball club earns him a shot at the majors, in Capital City.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x06: Dead Putting Society
goldenage.description: Lisa gives Bart some tips on handling the pressure in a miniature-golf grudge match with a neighbor's son.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x07: Bart vs. Thanksgiving
goldenage.description: On Thanksgiving, Bart runs away after accidentally wrecking Lisa's centerpiece.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x08: Bart the Daredevil
goldenage.description: After seeing a daredevil at a truck rally, Bart discovers his reason for living---a career in death defiance.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x09: Itchy & Scratchy & Marge
goldenage.description: Marge's protests over cartoon violence lead to a cultural renaissance in Springfield.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x10: Bart Gets Hit by a Car
goldenage.description: A lawyer suggests there may be profit in the pain after Bart suffers minor injuries in a collision with Burns' car.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x11: One Fish, Two Fish, Blowfish, Blue Fish
goldenage.description: Homer takes to sushi like a fish to water, but an apprentice chef may have given Homer some bad blowfish---and 24 hours to live.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x12: The Way We Was
goldenage.description: Marge and Homer reveal how they met as they tell a tale of love at first sight (but only for one) and the high-school prom they attended (but not together).

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x13: Homer vs. Lisa and the Eighth Commandment
goldenage.description: After learning eternal hell is the price for stealing, Lisa decides she'd rather go to heaven than watch pirated cable.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x14: Principal Charming
goldenage.description: Bart benefits when Principal Skinner falls for his Aunt Patty, who has Skinner but doesn't want him, while Aunt Selma has naught but want.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x15: Oh Brother, Where Art Thou?
goldenage.description: Danny DeVito is the voice of Homer's wealthy long-lost half brother, who makes the mistake of giving Homer an important job.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x16: Bart's Dog Gets an F
goldenage.description: Bart's dog is sent to obedience school after he destroys Homer's expensive new sneaks.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x17: Old Money
goldenage.description: Grandpa Simpson loses his love, leaving him with a heavy heart---and a heavy wallet when his sweetie leaves him money in her will.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x18: Brush with Greatness
goldenage.description: Ringo Starr has a cartoon cameo as Marge gets to paint a portrait of Mr. Burns.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x19: Lisa's Substitute
goldenage.description: Lisa finds that Homer pales in comparison with her substitute teacher, as does Bart with his opponent for class president.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x20: The War of the Simpsons
goldenage.description: Homer and Marge attend a marriage retreat, where Homer catches a legendary fish---and maybe more.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x21: Three Men and a Comic Book
goldenage.description: Bart earns less than he expected doing chores for a neighbor, so he goes partners with Milhouse and Martin on a rare comic book.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 2x22: Blood Feud
goldenage.description: After Bart's blood saves Burns, Homer sends his boss a nasty letter for falling short of the material gratitude that Homer expected.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x01: Stark Raving Dad
goldenage.description: A deviation from his norm lands Homer in a mental institution, where he shares a room with a man who thinks he's Michael Jackson.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x02: Mr. Lisa Goes to Washington
goldenage.description: Lisa's essay wins the Simpsons a trip to Washington, D.C., where her faith in democracy is shaken by her unethical Congressman.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x03: When Flanders Failed
goldenage.description: Flanders suffers a failure after Homer wishes him ill.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x04: Bart the Murderer
goldenage.description: While working for Fat Tony (Joe Mantegna), Bart gains enough influence with his boss to solve his problems with Principal Skinner---perhaps permanently.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x05: Homer Defined
goldenage.description: Homer's averting of a nuclear meltdown earns him employee-of-the-month honors---and a call from Magic Johnson; Milhouse's parents prohibit him from playing with Bart.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x06: Like Father Like Clown
goldenage.description: Bart and Lisa use theological arguments to try to reunite Krusty the Clown and his rabbi father, who disowned Krusty when he turned from rabbi to clown.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x07: Treehouse of Horror II
goldenage.description: Maggie uses one of three wishes; a mind-reading Bart rules Springfield; Homer donates his brain to Mr. Burns' science project.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x08: Lisa's Pony
goldenage.description: After disappointing Lisa, Homer buys her a pony, solving one problem, but creating others, requiring a second job---at Apu's Quik-e-Mart.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x09: Saturdays of Thunder
goldenage.description: When Homer helps Bart build a soapbox racer, it does little for the car but a lot for their relationship. Meanwhile, Patty and Selma get a hair makeover.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x10: Flaming Moe's
goldenage.description: Homer's new drink makes Moe's hot enough to draw Aerosmith, who perform "Walk This Way." Meanwhile, Lisa has invited her friends over for a slumber party which causes problems for Bart.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x11: Burns Verkaufen der Kraftwerk
goldenage.description: Burns sells the power plant to a German corporation that doesn't care for Homer's approach to his work.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x12: I Married Marge
goldenage.description: A trip down memory lane to the early days of Simpson wedded bliss, when Marge was with child and Homer was without a job.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x13: Radio Bart
goldenage.description: Bart fools the town into thinking there's a little boy trapped in a well. Sting performs "We're Sending Our Love down the Well."

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x14: Lisa the Greek
goldenage.description: From 1992: Lisa's ability to pick winning football teams kicks off a strong bond with Homer---which might end with the upcoming Super Bowl.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x15: Homer Alone
goldenage.description: A stressed Marge vacations alone, leaving Bart and Lisa with Patty and Selma, and Maggie with Homer---until she leaves in search of Marge.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x16: Bart the Lover
goldenage.description: Bart's answer to detention from Mrs. Krabappel is to answer her personal ad with letters from a Mr. Wonderful, but his last laugh is more of a guilty whimper. Meanwhile, Homer makes a bet with Flanders that if he tries to stop swearing, Flanders will shave off his mustache.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x17: Homer at the Bat
goldenage.description: Burns hires Major League ringers for the plant softball championship.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x18: Separate Vocations
goldenage.description: The results from their aptitude tests cause Bart and Lisa to make 180-degree turns in their behavior.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x19: Dog of Death
goldenage.description: Santa's Little Helper notices resentment after the Simpsons make sacrifices to fund his life-saving operation.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x20: Colonel Homer
goldenage.description: Marge fears a cheatin' heart when a waitress-country singer asks Homer to be her manager.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x21: Black Widower
goldenage.description: Bart suspects something rotten when Selma gets engaged to Sideshow Bob.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x22: The Otto Show
goldenage.description: Spinal Tap hits Springfield, and Otto the bus driver hits the skids after being fired, taking refuge in the Simpsons' garage.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x23: Bart's Friend Falls in Love
goldenage.description: Bart resents Milhouse's new girlfriend; Homer gets the wrong subliminal tape, which has him gaining vocabulary, not losing weight.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 3x24: Brother, Can You Spare Two Dimes?
goldenage.description: Homer's stepbrother asks for a loan after Homer is awarded some cash, presented by Smokin' Joe Frazier.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x01: Kamp Krusty
goldenage.description: Bart leads an uprising at Krusty's summer camp after he and Lisa are subjected to a Dickensian sweatshop.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x02: A Streetcar Named Marge
goldenage.description: Marge is cast in a version of "A Streetcar Named Desire," playing Blanche to Ned Flanders' Stanley.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x03: Homer the Heretic
goldenage.description: Homer decides to skip church permanently, and God gives His OK in Homer's dream.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x04: Lisa the Beauty Queen
goldenage.description: Lisa meets Bob Hope when she becomes Little Miss Springfield, a title she inherits after the winner's struck by lightning.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x05: Treehouse of Horror III
goldenage.description: A Halloween trilogy includes a murderous Krusty doll; a "King Kong" parody; an invasion of zombies unleashed by Bart's incantation.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x06: Itchy & Scratchy: The Movie
goldenage.description: Bart is punished by being barred from the Itchy and Scratchy movie.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x07: Marge Gets a Job
goldenage.description: Burns tries to please a new employee---Marge---with singer Tom Jones. Meanwhile, Bart cries "wolf" too often.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x08: The New Kid on the Block
goldenage.description: A new neighbor captures---and breaks---Bart's heart; Homer sues after a restaurant denies him "all you can eat."

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x09: Mr. Plow
goldenage.description: Homer and Barney become competitors in the snow-plowing business.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x10: Lisa's First Word
goldenage.description: Maggie speaks, but not before the story of Lisa's first word is recalled, as well as how the 1984 Soviet Olympic boycott hurt Krusty.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x11: Homer's Triple Bypass
goldenage.description: The stresses of life and his eating habits catch up and Homer sees a discount doctor for a coronary bypass.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x12: Marge vs. the Monorail
goldenage.description: Leonard Nimoy is among the first to ride Springfield's new monorail, opposed by Marge.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x13: Selma's Choice
goldenage.description: A relative passes away and the Simpson clan goes to the Funeral. After Selma receives a videotaped warning about dying alone, she wants a baby.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x14: Brother from the Same Planet
goldenage.description: Homer's neglect sends Bart looking for a new father; Lisa battles addiction to a "Springfield Heights, 90210" star.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x15: I Love Lisa
goldenage.description: Chief Wiggum's son has a crush on Lisa after she gives him a Valentine out of pity.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x16: Duffless
goldenage.description: Homer goes on the wagon after a drunken-driving arrest; Lisa's science project pits Bart's brain against a hamster's.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x17: Last Exit to Springfield
goldenage.description: Union president Homer fights to keep the dental plan.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x18: So It's Come to This: A Simpsons Clip Show
goldenage.description: Bart's prank hospitalizes Homer, whose life flashes by (in past clips) before he goes into a coma.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x19: The Front
goldenage.description: Lisa and Bart write an Itchy and Scratchy episode; Homer makes up a missing high-school credit.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x20: Whacking Day
goldenage.description: Barry White helps Lisa's effort to save snakes from Whacking Day. And, Bart is expelled from Springfield Elementary.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x21: Marge in Chains
goldenage.description: Lionel Hutz represents Marge after Apu catches her accidentally taking an item from his store.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 4x22: Krusty Gets Kancelled
goldenage.description: Johnny Carson, Bette Midler, Luke Perry, Hugh Hefner and the Red Hot Chili Peppers help Krusty when his show is canceled after a new star causes his ratings to plummet.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x01: Homer's Barbershop Quartet
goldenage.description: Homer recalls when he, Apu, Barney and Principal Skinner became recording icons---after Barney replaced Chief Wiggum, on the advice of their manager. Blackboard: 'I will never win an emmy'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x02: Cape Feare
goldenage.description: The Simpsons go incognito to avoid the newly paroled Sideshow Bob, who's out to get Bart. Blackboard: 'The cafeteria deep fryer is not a toy'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x03: Homer Goes to College
goldenage.description: Homer takes Nuclear Physics 101 at the local college, where he gets a trio of nerdy tutors expelled for extracurricular activities.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x04: Rosebud
goldenage.description: Burns longs for a childhood toy that winds up in the grip of Maggie.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x05: Treehouse of Horror IV
goldenage.description: Homer sells his soul; Vampire Burns invites the Simpsons for dinner; Bart sees a gremlin damaging his school bus.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x06: Marge on the Lam
goldenage.description: Marge's wild night out with neighbor Ruth (Pamela Reed) includes running from the police in Ruth's car, stolen from her ex.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x07: Bart's Inner Child
goldenage.description: Springfield emulates Bart after he's praised by a self-help guru. James Brown has a cameo at Springfield's Do What You Want festival.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x08: Boy-Scoutz 'n the Hood
goldenage.description: Bart joins the Junior Campers, which isn't all bad until he goes on a rafting trip that includes Flanders and "celebrity dad" Ernest Borgnine.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x09: The Last Temptation of Homer
goldenage.description: Homer is attracted to a pretty power-plant worker (voice of Michelle Pfeiffer), and Werner Klemperer speaks for the guardian angel who helps Homer fight temptation. Blackboard: 'All work and no play makes Bart a dull boy.'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x10: $pringfield (or, How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Legalized Gambling)
goldenage.description: Legalized gambling comes to Springfield, and Marge becomes addicted; Robert Goulet entertains at Bart's casino for kids. Blackboard: 'I will not say "Springfield" just to get applause'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x11: Homer the Vigilante
goldenage.description: Homer leads a vigilante group to catch the Springfield Cat Burglar (voice of Sam Neill), who then robs the museum. Blackboard: 'I am not authorized to fire substitute teachers'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x12: Bart Gets Famous
goldenage.description: When an on-air remark catapults Bart to instant stardom, he finds that fame isn't all it's cracked up to be. Blackboard: 'My homework was not stolen by a one-armed man'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x13: Homer and Apu
goldenage.description: Homer accompanies Apu to the Kwik-E-Mart home office---in India---after Apu is fired. Blackboard: 'I will not go near the kindergarten turtle'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x14: Lisa vs. Malibu Stacy
goldenage.description: Lisa's outrage over the gender stereotypes reinforced by a new talking doll prompts her to confront the dollmaker (Kathleen Turner).

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x15: Deep Space Homer
goldenage.description: Homer and Barney compete to be the first "average" American in space.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x16: Homer Loves Flanders
goldenage.description: Flanders' extra ticket to the big game makes him Homer's new best friend, a role that sorely tests Flanders' patience. Blackboard: 'I am not delightfully saucy'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x17: Bart Gets an Elephant
goldenage.description: Bart wins an elephant, but Homer won't let him keep it. Blackboard: 'Organ transplants are best left to the professionals'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x18: Burns' Heir
goldenage.description: Bart is picked to be Burns' heir and moves into the Burns mansion, prompting Homer and Marge to hire a deprogrammer to get him back. Blackboard: 'The pledge of Allegiance does not end with hail satan'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x19: Sweet Seymour Skinner's Baadasssss Song
goldenage.description: Bart takes his dog to school, which gets Skinner fired, which in turn leaves Bart missing his archnemesis. Blackboard: 'I will not celebrate meaningless milestones'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x20: The Boy Who Knew Too Much
goldenage.description: Bart can clear Mayor Quimby's nephew of a charge of battery, but only by implicating himself as a hooky player. Blackboard: 'There are plenty of businesses like show business'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x21: Lady Bouvier's Lover
goldenage.description: Grandpa Simpson falls for Marge's mother, but loses out to a competitor; Bart gets ripped off shopping at home with Homer's credit card.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 5x22: Secrets of a Successful Marriage
goldenage.description: Homer teaches a class on "Secrets of a Successful Marriage," but sharing secrets about his own union gets him kicked out of the house. Blackboard: 'Five days is not too long to wait for a gun'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x01: Bart of Darkness
goldenage.description: The Simpsons get a pool, but a broken leg sinks the summer for Bart. Blackboard: 'Beans are neither fruit nor musical'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x02: Lisa's Rival
goldenage.description: Lisa is dumbfounded by a new classmate who's younger, smarter and her competitor for first-chair sax. Meanwhile, Homer tries to profit after a truck spills its load of sugar.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x03: Another Simpsons Clip Show
goldenage.description: A family discussion of love yields stories (seen in flashbacks) that all end in heartbreak.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x04: Itchy & Scratchy Land
goldenage.description: Marge makes Homer promise not to embarrass her when they visit Itchy & Scratchy Land, "the violentest place on earth." Blackboard: 'I am not the reincarnation of Sammy Davis Jr.'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x05: Sideshow Bob Roberts
goldenage.description: Mayor Quimby pardons attempted murderer Sideshow Bob (Kelsey Grammer), who then runs against Quimby for mayor.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x06: Treehouse of Horror V
goldenage.description: Frightfest '94: Lack of beer and cable TV make Homer a crazed killer; the present is altered by a time-traveling Homer; and Principal Skinner turns detention students into food.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x07: Bart's Girlfriend
goldenage.description: Bart learns that the good Rev. Lovejoy's daughter (voice of Meryl Streep) is really bad. Blackboard: 'I will not send lard through the mail'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x08: Lisa on Ice
goldenage.description: Lisa's surprising ability at hockey spawns jealousy in Bart and a showdown when their teams meet.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x09: Homer Badman
goldenage.description: A baby sitter accuses Homer of sexual harassment. Dennis Franz has a voice cameo.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x10: Grandpa vs. Sexual Inadequacy
goldenage.description: Grandpa's homemade tonic puts life back in the Simpson bedroom, so he and Homer hit the road to sell the stuff. Blackboard: 'My homework was not stolen by a one-armed man'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x11: Fear of Flying
goldenage.description: Marge sees a psychiatrist (Anne Bancroft) to explore her fear of flying and learns that her father may be the key. Blackboard: 'Ralph won't "morph" if you squeeze him hard enough'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x12: Homer the Great
goldenage.description: Homer becomes the leader of a secret club, but his power is undermined by a "spiritual emptiness." Blackboard: 'Adding "Just kidding" doesn't make it okay to insult the principal'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x13: And Maggie Makes Three
goldenage.description: Homer recalls his days as a debt-free dad of two---until Marge got pregnant with Maggie.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x14: Bart's Comet
goldenage.description: A comet is hurtling toward Springfield, so the Simpsons take refuge in a bomb shelter---Flanders'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x15: Homie the Clown
goldenage.description: Homer graduates from Krusty's Clown College and becomes a target for the clown's bookie. Blackboard: 'Next time it could be me on the scaffolding'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x16: Bart vs. Australia
goldenage.description: After tricking an Australian boy into accepting a collect call, Bart flies Down Under to apologize. Blackboard: 'I will not hang donuts on my person'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x17: Homer vs. Patty and Selma
goldenage.description: A loan from Patty and Selma makes Homer their slave; Bart is forced to take ballet.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x18: A Star is Burns
goldenage.description: Film critic Jay Sherman (Jon Lovitz) is among the judges at the Springfield Film Festival, which Mr. Burns conspires to win by bribing some judges.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x19: Lisa's Wedding
goldenage.description: A fortuneteller predicts Lisa's engagement and wedding to a fellow student (Mandy Patinkin) from an upper-crust British family.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x20: Two Dozen and One Greyhounds
goldenage.description: The Simpson household's overrun with puppies---the offspring of Santa's Little Helper and his new girlfriend from which Mr. Burns would love to make a greyhound-skin tuxedo.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x21: The PTA Disbands
goldenage.description: Bart helps precipitate a teachers strike, but he rues his handiwork when Marge takes over for Mrs. Krabapple. Blackboard: 'I do not have power of attorney over first graders'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x22: Round Springfield
goldenage.description: Bart winds up in the hospital as a result of eating Krusty cereal, and when Lisa comes to visit him, she is reunited with her sax idol, who recounts his big break on "The Tonight Show.".  Blackboard: 'Nerve gas is not a toy'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x23: The Springfield Connection
goldenage.description: Marge joins the police force after thwarting a criminal, and Homer thinks he now has a free ride as a cop's spouse. Blackboard: 'I will not mock Mrs. Dumbface'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x24: Lemon of Troy
goldenage.description: Springfield boys try to recapture the town's beloved lemon tree after it's stolen.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 6x25: Who Shot Mr. Burns? (1)
goldenage.description: Mr. Burns makes many enemies when he steals the oil discovered beneath Springfield Elementary. Blackboard: 'This is not a clue...or is it?'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x01: Who Shot Mr. Burns? (2)
goldenage.description: Chief Wiggum conducts an investigation into who shot Mr. Burns in an episode that parodies TV dramas, including "Dallas," "Twin Peaks" and "The Fugitive." Blackboard: 'I will not complain about the solution when I hear it'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x02: Radioactive Man
goldenage.description: Bart auditions for the part of Fallout Boy in the movie "Radioactive Man," being filmed in Springfield. Blackboard: 'Bewitched does not support satanism'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x03: Home Sweet Homediddly-Dum-Doodily
goldenage.description: Innocent mishaps draw the attention of investigators, who put the Simpson kids in a foster home---the Flanders'. Blackboard: 'No one want's to hear from my armpits'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x04: Bart Sells His Soul
goldenage.description: Bart sells his soul to Milhouse for five bucks; Moe goes after the family crowd. Blackboard 'I am not a lean mean spitting machine.'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x05: Lisa the Vegetarian
goldenage.description: Vegetarian Lisa ruins Homer's barbecue, but she gets moral support from Apu and his friends, Paul and Linda McCartney.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x06: Treehouse of Horror VI
goldenage.description: Halloween 1996: Homer tumbles into another dimension in a story spun off "The Twilight Zone"; Paul Anka helps combat the "Attack of the 50-Foot Eyesores"; and Groundskeeper Willie appears in a spoof of "A Nightmare on Elm Street."

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x07: King-Size Homer
goldenage.description: Homer purposely gains weight to qualify for disability, disdaining Marge's complaints and the fact that she's losing interest in him physically. Blackboard: 'Indian burns are not our cultural heritage'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x08: Mother Simpson
goldenage.description: Homer comes face-to-face with his long-lost mother (voice of Glenn Close)---who reveals why she abandoned him.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x09: Sideshow Bob's Last Gleaming
goldenage.description: Sideshow Bob (voice of Kelsey Grammer) steals an atomic bomb and demands that Springfield abolish television. Blackboard: 'Wedgies are unhealthy for children and other living things'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x10: The Simpsons 138th Episode Spectacular
goldenage.description: Troy McClure hosts a retrospective featuring Simpsons history and trivia, and series "outtakes," including an alternate ending to the "Who Shot Mr. Burns?" episode and a burping contest between Barney and baseball's Wade Boggs.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x11: Marge Be Not Proud
goldenage.description: Busted for shoplifting, Bart manages to keep the incident quiet---until he returns to the store for the Simpsons' Christmas portrait. And the news is devastating to Marge. Blackboard: 'I will stop talking about the twelve inch pianist'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x12: Team Homer
goldenage.description: Homer, Moe, Apu and Otto form a bowling team; Bart's prank leads Springfield Elementary to adopt school uniforms. Blackboard: 'I am not certified to remove asbestos'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x13: Two Bad Neighbors
goldenage.description: Homer is irked by his new neighbors, former U.S. President George Bush and Former U.S. First Lady Barbara Bush, especially when Mr. Bush gives Bart a spanking and criticizes Homer's parenting for menacing and ruined to have the outboard motor to damage Former President George Bush's new memoirs that he was working in his autobiography.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x14: Scenes from the Class Struggle in Springfield
goldenage.description: Marge's new designer suit nets her an invitation to the Springfield Country Club, where she finds it's a stress to dress to impress. Meanwhile, "natural" golfer Homer hits the links with Mr. Burns.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x15: Bart the Fink
goldenage.description: Bart inadvertently alerts the IRS to tax fraud by Krusty, whose possessions are auctioned off by the Government.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x16: Lisa the Iconoclast
goldenage.description: Lisa's research on Jebediah Springfield turns up some unknown---and unpopular---facts.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x17: Homer the Smithers
goldenage.description: Homer succumbs to job stress while subbing for Smithers as Burns' assistant.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x18: The Day the Violence Died
goldenage.description: Bart wants justice done after learning that the animator (voice of Kirk Douglas) who created Itchy was ripped off. Lionel Hutz takes the animator's case.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x19: A Fish Called Selma
goldenage.description: Selma dates Troy McClure, whose agent (voice of Jeff Goldblum) reports that being seen in public with a woman is a career boost that could make people forget "that scandal at the aquarium."

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x20: Bart on the Road
goldenage.description: Bart drives Milhouse, Martin and Nelson to Tennessee, thanks to his fake ID and Martin's cash from a stock dividend.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x21: 22 Short Films About Springfield
goldenage.description: Interconnecting vignettes depict moments in the lives of Springfield residents, including Apu's partying activities; Smithers' allergic reaction to a bee sting; and Dr. Nick's appearance before a medical review board.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x22: Raging Abe Simpson and His Grumbling Grandson in "The Curse of the Flying Hellfish"
goldenage.description: Mr. Burns tries to kill Grampa Simpson to seize a treasure the two found during World War II as members of the "Flying Hellfish" battalion.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x23: Much Apu About Nothing
goldenage.description: Marge and Homer support a proposal to deport illegal immigrants from Springfield---until they learn it would affect Apu, who buys fraudulent identification documents from Fat Tony (voice of Joe Mantegna).

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x24: Homerpalooza
goldenage.description: Homer goes on tour with Hullabalooza, a rock concert featuring sideshow acts. His talent: catching a cannonball with his belly.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 7x25: Summer of 4 ft. 2
goldenage.description: On vacation, Lisa plays dumb to make friends with the "cool" kids, leaving a jealous Bart all burned up, with Milhouse as his only comrade.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x01: Treehouse of Horror VII
goldenage.description: A Halloween trilogy. This time, Bart meets his "pure evil" Siamese twin; Lisa's science project attacks Bart; aliens Kang and Kodos invade Clinton and Dole's replicas just before the 1996 Presidential election.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x02: You Only Move Twice
goldenage.description: In an idyllic planned community, Homer works for a new boss who has trouble with the government. Meanwhile, the rest of the family has difficulty dealing with the bucolic burg. Blackboard: 'I did not learn everything I need to know in kindergarten'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x03: The Homer They Fall
goldenage.description: Moe turns Homer into a prizefighter, who meets the champ in a bout called by ring announcer Michael Buffer.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x04: Burns, Baby Burns
goldenage.description: Rodney Dangerfield is the voice of Mr. Burns' illegitimate son, who irritates Burns with his lack of social graces. Homer and Mr. Burn's son hatch a scheme to get Mr. Burns's attention.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x05: Bart After Dark
goldenage.description: While Marge and Lisa are away, Bart becomes the right-hand man for the owner of a burlesque house.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x06: A Milhouse Divided
goldenage.description: Milhouse's parents decide to divorce, prompting Homer to take action to prevent a similar fate for himself and Marge.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x07: Lisa's Date with Density
goldenage.description: Lisa develops a crush on Nelson, and then she tries to change him. Meanwhile, Homer solicits money over the phone using an automatic telephone dialer.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x08: Hurricane Neddy
goldenage.description: Citizens rebuild the Flanders' hurricane-damaged house. But Ned's guilt about criticizing their work sends him to a mental hospital.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x09: El Viaje de Nuestro Jomer (The Mysterious Voyage of Homer)
goldenage.description: Chief Wiggum's chili peppers send Homer on a hallucinatory, spiritual journey that makes him question whether Marge is his soulmate.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x10: The Springfield Files
goldenage.description: Homer's claim of an alien sighting brings FBI agents Scully and Mulder to investigate. Blackboard: 'The truth is not out there'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x11: The Twisted World of Marge Simpson
goldenage.description: A smooth talker sells Marge on the pretzel business. But when sales go soft, Homer asks crime boss Fat Tony for help. Blackboard "I am not licensed to do anything".

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x12: Mountain of Madness
goldenage.description: On a company mountain retreat, an avalanche traps hiking partners Homer and Mr. Burns in a cabin.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x13: Simpsoncalifragilisticexpiala (Annoyed Grunt) cious
goldenage.description: When Marge suffers stress-related hair loss, the Simpsons hire nanny Shary Bobbins, who speaks in song and inspires others to do so. But the Simpsons may prove too much for her. Blackboard: 'I will not hide the teacher's prozac'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x14: The Itchy & Scratchy & Poochie Show
goldenage.description: Itchy and Scratchy creator Roger Myers picks Homer to be the voice of a new canine character---who is roundly rejected by the public.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x15: Homer's Phobia
goldenage.description: Homer's fearful about the potential influence that the Simpsons' new gay friend may have on Bart.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x16: Brother from Another Series
goldenage.description: Murderous convict Sideshow Bob (Kelsey Grammer) is released to work for his brother Cecil (David Hyde Pierce), whom Bob bested at the Krusty-sidekick audition.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x17: My Sister, My Sitter
goldenage.description: Lisa's reputation as a first-rate baby sitter is jeopardized when she's put in charge of Bart, who's determined to make things tough.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x18: Homer vs. the Eighteenth Amendment
goldenage.description: Homer becomes a bootlegger when Springfield decides to enforce a 200-year-old prohibition decree.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x19: Grade School Confidential
goldenage.description: After witnessing a kiss between Skinner and Mrs. Krabappel, Bart becomes their confidante. But rumors of their passion lead to their being fired---until Skinner reveals a secret.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x20: The Canine Mutiny
goldenage.description: Bart replaces Santa's Little Helper with a "limited edition" dog he bought with a fraudulent credit card. Blackboard: 'A fire drill does not demand a fire'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x21: The Old Man and Lisa
goldenage.description: Penniless from bad investments, Burns asks for help from Lisa, who turns him into a profitable recycler. But then Burns takes things a nasty step further to increase his dividends.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x22: In Marge We Trust
goldenage.description: Reverend Lovejoy puts Marge in charge of counseling parishioners; Homer finds his likeness is popular in Japan as the symbol for a cleaning product.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x23: Homer's Enemy
goldenage.description: A new plant employee who's had it tough resents Homer's lack of professionalism and his cushy life. Meanwhile, Bart buys an abandoned factory at an auction for a dollar.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x24: The Simpsons Spin-Off Showcase
goldenage.description: Three mock spin-offs: "Chief Wiggum, P.I."; "The Love-Matic Grandpa"; and "The Simpson Family Smile-Time Variety Hour," with guest star Tim Conway and a teen stand-in for Lisa.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 8x25: The Secret War of Lisa Simpson
goldenage.description: Lisa joins the all-male military school where Bart is sent for discipline. Then comes the hazing.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x01: The City of New York vs. Homer Simpson
goldenage.description: Homer has to take his family to New York city for a madcap adventure after Barney goes on a bender and leaves Homer's car illegally parked at the World Trade Center.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x02: The Principal and the Pauper
goldenage.description: Principal Skinner is given a achievement award and in the middle of the ceremony a man who claims to be the real Seymour Skinner shows up.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x03: Lisa's Sax
goldenage.description: The story of how Lisa got her sax includes Bart's first day at school, his visit to the school psychologist and a heat wave in Springfield.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x04: Treehouse of Horror VIII
goldenage.description: In a Halloween trilogy, nuclear survivor Homer battles mutants; Bart is morphed with a fly; Marge is accused of being a witch in 1649.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x05: The Cartridge Family
goldenage.description: Homer buys a gun, but after a few mishaps, Marge demands he get rid of it. When he doesn't, she leaves with the kids. Blackboard: 'Everyone is tired of that Richard Gere story'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x06: Bart Star
goldenage.description: Homer heckles Flanders out of coaching Pee Wee football---and then takes over, replacing winning QB Nelson with Bart.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x07: The Two Mrs. Nahasapeemapetilons
goldenage.description: Apu tries to wriggle out of a marriage prearranged by his mother years in the past to a woman that he does not remember.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x08: Lisa the Skeptic
goldenage.description: While digging at a construction site, Lisa finds bones that everyone thinks are the bones of a angel.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x09: Realty Bites
goldenage.description: Marge gets a realtor's license and goes to work---for Lionel Hutz, who finds her honesty a dubious asset. Meanwhile, Homer buys a hot rod at a police auction, but the incarcerated former owner protests. Blackboard "There was no Roman God named 'Fartacus' ".

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x10: Miracle on Evergreen Terrace
goldenage.description: After accidentally destroying the Simpsons' Christmas gifts, Bart claims a burglar stole them, and Springfield responds generously to that false news. Blackboard: 'Rudolph's red nose is not alcohol-related'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x11: All Singing, All Dancing
goldenage.description: Homer rents Paint Your Wagon with Lee Marvin and Clint Eastwood expecting a Shoot 'Em up western. He is so disappointed about it that Marge and Lisa have to try and cheer him up.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x12: Bart Carny
goldenage.description: Homer and Bart become carnival workers, and take in two fellow carnies whose crooked game is closed by Chief Wiggum.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x13: The Joy of Sect
goldenage.description: Homer is talked into joining a cult at the airport. The cult promises to take people to another planet. Marge has to work hard to get through the brainwashing. Blackboard: 'Shooting paintballs is not an art form'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x14: Das Bus
goldenage.description: A bus accident strands Bart, Lisa and their classmates on an island; Homer starts a business on the Internet.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x15: The Last Temptation of Krusty
goldenage.description: Krusty makes a fool of himself at the Springfield Comedy Festival and decides to retire. Once at the retirement ceremony he discovers how to make people laugh.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x16: Dumbbell Indemnity
goldenage.description: Moe finally finds a woman to date, then has Homer help him with a insurance scam to get more money to spend on her. Blackboard: 'Silly string is not a nasal spray'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x17: Lisa the Simpson
goldenage.description: Grandpa says "Simpson genes" are behind Lisa's sudden lack of brain power; Jasper tries to live for the future in the Kwik-E-Mart freezer.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x18: This Little Wiggy
goldenage.description: Marge orders Bart to play with Ralph Wiggum, an appalling task---until Bart gets hold of Chief Wiggum's master key to the city. Blackboard: 'I was not told to do this'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x19: Simpson Tide
goldenage.description: When Homer comes up with a not so bright idea at work involving a donut and the nuclear core, Mr. Burns fires him. He then decides to join the Naval Reserve when Lisa tells him that she would be proud of him if he did. Later a nuclear-sub captain puts naval reservist Homer in command during war games. Blackboard: "My butt does not deserve a website".

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x20: The Trouble with Trillions
goldenage.description: Homer gets in trouble with the IRS for his taxes and has to get proof that Burns has money the government wants for them in return.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x21: Girly Edition
goldenage.description: Lisa becomes the anchor for a kids news show when Krusty's producers try to spice up his program. Bart takes over the show when he is made co-anchor of the program.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x22: Trash of the Titans
goldenage.description: Homer becomes head of the Springfield Sanitation department and makes outrageous promises that he can't keep. Homer also disrupts a U2 concert.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x23: King of the Hill
goldenage.description: Homer gets in shape (no, really!) and climbs a mountain to promote the alleged health-food product that helped him achieve success.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x24: Lost Our Lisa
goldenage.description: Lisa tricks Homer into giving her permission to take the bus downtown alone---then she gets lost. Blackboard; 'I am not the new Dali Lama'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 9x25: Natural Born Kissers
goldenage.description: Homer and Marge try to find ways to spice up their love life by experimenting with risky locals. Blackboard: 'I was not the inspiration for "Kramer"'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x01: Lard of the Dance
goldenage.description: A hip new student makes an impression at Springfield Elementary; Homer drags Bart into grease recycling.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x02: The Wizard of Evergreen Terrace
goldenage.description: Homer goes through a bought of midlife depression and tries to overcome it with a string of inventions inspire by Thomas Edison.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x03: Bart the Mother
goldenage.description: After an accident with a gun, Bart becomes the caretaker of the eggs from a birds nest.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x04: Treehouse of Horror IX
goldenage.description: The ninth Halloween show. Included: Homer turns evil after a hair transplant; Bart and Lisa get trapped inside their TV; the alien Kang is revealed as Maggie's father.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x05: When You Dish Upon a Star
goldenage.description: Homer becomes an assistant to Kim Basinger and Alec Baldwin (and their houseguest, Ron Howard), none of whom are interested in his screenplay. Blackboard: 'Butt-Butt is not my email address'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x06: D'Oh-in' in the Wind
goldenage.description: In a quest to discover his middle name, Homer meets some of his mothers old hippie friends. He then starts to live a hippy lifestyle.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x07: Lisa Gets an "A"
goldenage.description: Lisa gets sick then does not study and ends up buying test answers from Nelson.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x08: Homer Simpson in: "Kidney Trouble"
goldenage.description: Homer takes the family on a trip and does not stop on the way home so Grandpa Simpson can go to the bathroom. This results in Grandpa needing a kidney transplant and Homer has compatible kidney's with his dad.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x09: Mayored to the Mob
goldenage.description: Homer becomes the mayor's bodyguard and puts a stop to a crooked operation involving Fat Tony, who vows revenge on the mayor.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x10: Viva Ned Flanders
goldenage.description: Ned is feeling depressed and Homer talks him into going to Las Vegas. After arriving, they spend a wild night on the town and wake up married to two Las Vegas wives. Blackboard: 'My mom is not dating Jerry Seinfeld'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x11: Wild Barts Can't Be Broken
goldenage.description: Wiggum declares a curfew for kids, who are being blamed for school vandalism committed by a drunken Homer and friends. Blackboard: 'Sherri does not "Get Back"'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x12: Sunday, Cruddy Sunday
goldenage.description: Homer leads a slew of Springfield denizens to the Super Bowl. Blackboard: 'I will not do the dirty bird'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x13: Homer to the Max
goldenage.description: Homer discovers a cool Tv character with his name and then they turn the character into a dummy and Homer becomes mortified. He then changes his name and a lot of things change for him.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x14: I'm with Cupid
goldenage.description: Apu invites Homer and Marge over to his house for dinner and Manjula finds out that most American men do not work 7 days a week 12 plus hours a day and flips out. Apu then begins a series of daily gifts leading up to Valentines day for Manjula which causes all the other wives in Springfield to get Jealous of the attention she is getting from Apu. This causes the men of Springfield to be in the doghouse with their wives and them to be mad at Apu.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x15: Marge Simpson in: "Screaming Yellow Honkers"
goldenage.description: Marge gets a new sports utility vehicle and develops a bad case of road rage. She then has to go to driving school. Blackboard: 'Grammar is not a time of waste'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x16: Make Room for Lisa
goldenage.description: Homer damages the bill of rights at the museum and gives away Lisa's room to compensate for it. Lisa has to move in with Bart. Marge discover that Maggie's baby monitor is picking up local phone calls. Blackboard: 'I do not have diplomatic immunity'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x17: Maximum Homerdrive
goldenage.description: Truck drivers target Homer after he blabs about an industry scam while filling in for a recently deceased driver.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x18: Simpsons Bible Stories
goldenage.description: The family's biblical dreams include Homer and Marge as Adam and Eve, with Flanders as God; Milhouse as Moses; and Bart as David battling Goliath's son ("this time, it's personal").

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x19: Mom and Pop Art
goldenage.description: Isabella Rossellini plays a gallery owner who sees art in the concrete mess that results from Homer's attempt at building a barbeque. After the piece sells, she arranges a one-man show. Blackboard: 'A trained ape could not teach gym'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x20: The Old Man and the "C" Student
goldenage.description: Bart puts on a show that causes Springfield to loose hosting the Olympic Games. For punishment, he is forced to volunteer at Grandpa's retirement home.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x21: Monty Can't Buy Me Love
goldenage.description: After another billionaire makes a memorable impression on Springfield, Burns asks for Homer's help on a quest for popularity, which eventually takes them both to Scotland.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x22: They Saved Lisa's Brain
goldenage.description: Lisa is invited to join local members of Mensa, who take a complaint to City Hall---and wind up running it. Blackboard: 'No one wants to hear from my armpits.'.

goldenage.title: The Simpsons 10x23: 30 Minutes Over Tokyo
goldenage.description: After getting tips on thrifty living, the family takes a vacation to Japan, where they appear on a game show to win plane tickets back home. Blackboard: 'I'm so very tired'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x01: Beyond Blunderdome
remaining.description: Mel Gibson brings the Simpsons to Hollywood so Homer can help "tweak" his new film after Homer's is the sole negative voice at a test screening. First tweak: add action, and lots of it.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x02: Brother's Little Helper
remaining.description: A drug for Attention Deficit Disorder makes Bart studious, productive---and paranoid about satellites spying on him. Blackboard 'Pork is not a Verb'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x03: Guess Who's Coming to Criticize Dinner
remaining.description: After crashing a food critic's retirement party for the food, Homer ends up taking the lady's place as food critic. He then has Lisa proofread his column and the power goes to his head. The French chef bakes him a very special eclair because of his bad reviews. Blackboard 'I am not the last Don'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x04: Treehouse of Horror X
remaining.description: A Halloween trilogy: Homer causes a Y2K catastrophe; superheroes Lisa and Bart save actress Lucy Lawless; Marge runs Flanders over, and Homer tries to cover it up. Dick Clark and Tom Arnold also appear as themselves.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x05: E-I-E-I-(Annoyed Grunt)
remaining.description: Homer thinks dueling is great and because of that, the Simpsons end up having to move to a old farm and Homer grows a highly addictive crop after fertilizing the field with plutonium.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x06: Hello Gutter, Hello Fadder
remaining.description: Homer cuts out of work to bowl a perfect game then has trouble staying in the limelight afterwords.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x07: Eight Misbehavin
remaining.description: Feeling more stressed than blessed after the birth of their octuplets, Apu and Manjula get child-care help in a deal they come to regret.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x08: Take My Wife, Sleaze
remaining.description: Homer wins a motorcycle and starts his own gang. The he gets entangled with a real motorcycle gang and they kidnap Marge. Blackboard "I can't see dead people".

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x09: Grift of the Magi
remaining.description: Bankrupt Springfield Elementary is taken over by a private outfit whose members' real goal is to mine the kids' minds for toy ideas. Blackboard ' I will not sell my kidney on Ebay.'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x10: Little Big Mom
remaining.description: With Marge laid up by a skiing (lodge) accident, Lisa tries to run the house and plays a trick on Homer and Bart to get them to help clean. Blackboard: 'I will not create art from dung'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x11: Faith Off
remaining.description: After Bart's successful laying on of hands at a revival meeting, a preacher declares Bart has "the power." So the boy pitches his own tent. Blackboard: 'I will stop phoning it in'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x12: The Mansion Family
remaining.description: The Simpsons have to take care of Mr. Burn's mansion while he is at the Mayo Clinic getting a checkup. Homer takes advantage of it. Blackboard 'Class Clown is not a paid position'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x13: Saddlesore Galactica
remaining.description: The band Bachman Turner Overdrive preforms at the State Fair. Bart and Homer rescue a horse from the State fair. Homer then starts racing the horse with Bart as the Jockey. Later, Homer discovers a secret about horse jockeys. Lisa's school band competes in a band contest and the winning school band cheats. Lisa then writes a letter to the President of the USA.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x14: Alone Again Natura-Diddily
remaining.description: The Simpsons go on a nature hike and Marge discovers that the bird preserve she loves has been turned into a racetrack. During the race a bad accident happens causing someone to pass away, the Simpsons console a grieving friend.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x15: Missionary Impossible
remaining.description: Homer is forced to become a missionary on a remote island after he pledges a large sum of money to a local PBS station.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x16: Pygmoelian
remaining.description: Moe wins Duff's "beer-tending" contest but loses out on making their calendar. So he undergoes plastic surgery and lands a soap-opera role that he missed years before.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x17: Bart to the Future
remaining.description: Bart attempts to sneak into an Indian casino by replacing the ventriloquist dummy and the head of the casino shows him the future when Lisa is President of the United States.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x18: Days of Wine and D'Ohses
remaining.description: Barney quits drinking to take helicopter-flying lessons, leaving Homer feeling resentful and inferior; Lisa and Bart enter a contest to photograph the cover of the Springfield phone book.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x19: Kill the Alligator and Run
remaining.description: In Florida, Homer gets caught up in spring break partying and accidentally runs over "Captain Jack" a iconic swamp alligator and the family has to go on the lam. Blackboard: "I am not here on a fartball scholarship".

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x20: Last Tap Dance in Springfield
remaining.description: Bart and Milhouse camp out in a shopping mall for a week and drive Chief Wiggam crazy, while Lisa enrolls in a tap dance school run by a former child star who is full of herself.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x21: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge
remaining.description: Otto's girlfriend seems to be usurping Marge's role when she moves in with the family after a dispute over heavy metal.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 11x22: Behind the Laughter
remaining.description: A clip show like episode of behinds the scenes as if Simpsons were a real family doing unanimated tv.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x01: Treehouse of Horror XI
remaining.description: In the 11th annual Halloween trilogy, a ghostly Homer tries to perform a good deed on Earth; Bart and Lisa are trapped in a fairy-tale forest; and dolphins revolt against humans after Lisa frees their king from the Springfield Marine Park.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x02: A Tale of Two Springfields
remaining.description: Homer gets frustrated because Springfield now has to area codes for phone calls and he divides the Town, becomes mayor of New Springfield. He then wages war against Olde Springfield and it is up to The Who to reunite the town.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x03: Insane Clown Poppy
remaining.description: While Krusty is signing autographs, Bart meets a girl who turns out to be Krusty's daughter. Krusty then spends a day at the beach with her and later that night he gambles away his daughter Sophie's violin. He then recruits Homer to help him get it back from Fat Tony and the Mob. Blackboard 'I will not surprise the incontinent'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x04: Lisa the Treehugger
remaining.description: Joshua Jackson plays a committed---and cute---teen environmentalist who inspires Lisa to take up residence in a redwood tree to save it from destruction. Blackboard 'I am not the acting President'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x05: Homer vs. Dignity
remaining.description: With Smithers away, Burns hires a cash-hungry Homer as his "prank monkey" to perform stunts that ultimately damage Homer's dignity. Leeza Gibbons has a cameo. Blackboard 'I was not the sixth Beattle'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x06: The Computer Wore Menace Shoes
remaining.description: After having to go to work because he did not get the email about the day off, Homer buys a computer and starts a tell all web page. He then wins a award for the web site. Blackboard 'I will only provide a urine sample when asked'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x07: The Great Money Caper
remaining.description: Homer and Bart turn into a couple of con artists in order to pay for a really high car repair bill. Blackboard 'The nurse is not dealing'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x08: Skinner's Sense of Snow
remaining.description: A blizzard traps Skinner and Groundskeeper Willie with an assortment of students at Springfield Elementary. Bart (of course) leads the revolt.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x09: HOMR
remaining.description: Researchers find and fix the cause of Homer's "subnormal" intelligence, but Homer finds life as a brain is a drain on his popularity. Blackboard 'Network TV is not dead'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x10: Pokey Mom
remaining.description: Homer hurts his back at a prison rodeo, where Marge meets an artistic inmate whom she takes under her wing. Blackboard 'I will not "Let The Dogs Out!"''

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x11: Worst Episode Ever
remaining.description: Bart and Milhouse are at the Android Dungeon and end up being banned from the store for a lifetime. After Comic Book Guy has a heart attack, Bart and Milhouse take over running the store for him. Once Comic Book Guy recovers, he starts dating Principle Skinners mother. Blackboard 'I will not hide the teacher's medication'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x12: Tennis the Menace
remaining.description: The Simpsons win points for their new tennis court, but constantly lose on Homer's poor play. Blackboard 'I will not publish the principal's credit report'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x13: Day of the Jackanapes
remaining.description: Sideshow Bob talks his way out of prison and into a job at the school. There, he hypnotizes Bart---to make him kill Krusty, who plans a final show after growing sick of network interference. Blackboard 'The hamster did not have "A Full Life"'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x14: New Kids on the Blecch
remaining.description: After Bart pulls a stunt during the Springfield Marathon, Lt. Smash boy-band creator recruits Bart, Nelson, Milhouse and Ralph to create a boy band. NSYNC visit's Springfield. Blackboard 'I will not buy a presidential pardon'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x15: Hungry Hungry Homer
remaining.description: The family goes to Blocko land, Homer stands up to a guy for Lisa. Homer then proceeds to go on a hunger strike protesting a decision the Springfield Isotopes baseball teams owner is in the process of making.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x16: Bye Bye Nerdy
remaining.description: A new girl joins the elementary class and Lisa tries to figure out why she is bullying everyone. Homer goes on a mission to baby proof Springfield. Blackboard: 'I will not scare the vice president'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x17: Simpsons Safari
remaining.description: Hungry Homer rips into a 30 year old box of animal crackers and finds a winning ticket for a trip to Africa. He then demands his prize. Blackboard: 'I will not flush evidence'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x18: Trilogy of Error
remaining.description: Homer's severed thumb, Lisa's science project and Bart's discovery of fireworks prompt separate but simultaneous adventures that conclude with an encounter with mobster Fat Tony. Blackboard: 'Fire is not the cleanser'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x19: I'm Goin' to Praise Land
remaining.description: With Homer's help, Ned Flanders tries to establish a Christian theme park based on drawings in his deceased wife's sketch book. Blackboard: 'Genetics is not an excuse'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x20: Children of a Lesser Clod
remaining.description: Homer opens a day-care center in the house, prompting envy in Lisa and Bart when he treats other kids better than he treats them. Blackboard 'Today is not Mothra's day'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 12x21: Simpsons Tall Tales
remaining.description: Folk-tale parodies abound, with Homer as Paul Bunyan; Lisa as Connie Appleseed; and Bart as Tom Sawyer, helping to save Huck Finn from a shotgun marriage to Becky Thatcher. Blackboard: 'I should not be twenty-one by now'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x01: Treehouse of Horror XII
remaining.description: "Treehouse of Horror XII" includes Pierce Brosnan as the voice of a computerized house that falls for Marge; a Gypsy's curse bringing bad luck to Homer's loved ones; and Bart and Lisa as competing wizards, with Bart enlisting help from a dark source.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x02: The Parent Rap
remaining.description: Bart is tethered to Homer as punishment for stealing a police cruiser. Blackboard 'Nobody reads these anymore!'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x03: Homer the Moe
remaining.description: Moe gets more depressed than usual and renovates his tavern. He then kicks the old gang out and Homer opens a bar in his garage so the gang can have a place to hang out and fit in.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x04: Hunka Hunka Burns in Love
remaining.description: Homer is hired to write fortunes for fortune cookies, one of them changes Mr. Burn's life. Homer helps Mr. Burns with his dating. Blackboard: 'Fun does not have a size'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x05: The Blunder Years
remaining.description: Marge becomes obsessed with a brand of paper towels and Homer pulls a gag on her. To make up for it, Homer takes her out, gets hypnotized and regresses to a childhood fear and starts screaming and does not stop until the source of the fear is drawn out of him. Blackboard 'I am not Charlie Brown on acid'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x06: She of Little Faith
remaining.description: In this Christmas episode, Richard Gere offers Buddhist teachings to Lisa after she leaves her church because of Mr. Burns' tacky fund-raising efforts, which include commercials (during sermons) and podium-placed ads. Blackboard: 'I do not have a cereal named after me'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x07: Brawl in the Family
remaining.description: Grampa comes to Homer's rescue after Ned and His Vegas wives show up at the house.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x08: Sweets and Sour Marge
remaining.description: Ben Stiller plays a sugar company's CEO who draws Marge's ire after Springfield is declared the "World's Fattest Town."

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x09: Jaws Wired Shut
remaining.description: When Homer accidentally breaks his jaw, he has to have it wired shut and can not talk. He learns to become the good listener that Marge has wanted.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x10: Half-Decent Proposal
remaining.description: Now fabulously wealthy, Marge's grabby prom date Artie Ziff offers a million dollars for a weekend with her that, he says, will have "no funny stuff." The Simpsons agree when they realize the money will help their marriage---by paying for an operation that will cure Homer's snoring.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x11: The Bart Wants What It Wants
remaining.description: Bart ends up becoming close friends with Greta Wolfecastle after a fun fair and he has a blind eye to her feelings about him. Blackboard: 'The giving tree is not a chump'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x12: The Lastest Gun in the West
remaining.description: Bart and Lisa try to help an old cowboy actor, who yearns to reclaim his past fame by getting him booked on the Krusty the Clown show.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x13: The Old Man and the Key
remaining.description: Grampa Simpson regains his driver's license to woo a new woman but is goaded into a race by senior punks.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x14: Tales from the Public Domain
remaining.description: Homer discovers a library book he checked out when Bart was born and Lisa suggests that he read aloud from it. Blackboard: 'Vampire is not a career choice'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x15: Blame It on Lisa
remaining.description: Homer refuses to pay a really high phone bill then their service is shut off. The family travels to Rio De Janeiro to see Lisa's sponsored orphan.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x16: Weekend at Burnsies
remaining.description: Homer uses medicinal marijuana to relieve pain from eye injuries he suffered when attacked by crows.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x17: Gump Roast
remaining.description: The Springfield Friars Club roasts Homer, with emcee Krusty the Clown introducing friends, family and their memories from past episodes.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x18: I Am Furious Yellow
remaining.description: Encouraged by comic-book guru Stan Lee (in a cameo), Bart creates a strip about Homer that gets onto the Internet.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x19: The Sweetest Apu
remaining.description: Homer accidentally walks in on Apu when he is cheating on his wife at the Kwiki Mart.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x20: Little Girl in the Big Ten
remaining.description: Lisa becomes friends with college girls who are unaware of her age. Bart is bitten by a Chinese mosquito and must live in a bubble. Bart and Lisa also share a special moment.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x21: Frying Game
remaining.description: Homer's community service for threatening an endangered species involves helping a kindly senior, who meets an untimely death.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 13x22: Papa's Got a Brand New Badge
remaining.description: Homer starts a security company that ultimately replaces the cops---and runs afoul of mobster Fat Tony

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x01: Treehouse of Horror XIII
remaining.description: "Treehouse of Horror XIII" finds Homer cloned; Dr. Hibbert turning the family into half animals; and Springfield invaded by zombie cowboys.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x02: How I Spent My Strummer Vacation
remaining.description: Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, Tom Petty, Elvis Costello, Lenny Kravitz and Brian Setzer are the teachers when Homer attends a rock-and-roll fantasy camp.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x03: Bart vs. Lisa vs. 3rd Grade
remaining.description: After testing, Lisa is moved up a grade and Bart is held back so they are both in the 3rd grade together. The teacher thinks Bart is the smarter of the two since he already knows everything. They go on a field trip to Capital City and get left behind and lost. Blackboard 'Fish do not like Coffee'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x04: Large Marge
remaining.description: Marge gets breast implants meant for Mayor Quimby's young girlfriend; Bart and Milhouse spot Krusty the Clown on a old episode of Batman.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x05: Helter Shelter
remaining.description: The Simpsons end up with termites after going to a hockey game and have to stay out of their house for 6 months. They end up on a reality series where they live in a 1880's type house and life style. Blackboard: 'Milhouse did not test cootie positive'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x06: The Great Louse Detective
remaining.description: Someone's trying to kill Homer, so Chief Wiggum consults an expert: Sideshow Bob, who moves in with the Simpsons to shadow Homer.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x07: Special Edna (a.k.a. Love and Marking)
remaining.description: Bart feels sorry for Mrs. Krabappel after she is stood up by Principle Skinner, so he nominates her for an award.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x08: The Dad Who Knew Too Little
remaining.description: Homer feels bad because he does not know much about Lisa so he hires a private detective to spy on her. He then becomes a big hit with her because of the information.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x09: The Strong Arms of the Ma
remaining.description: After she is mugged, Marge retreats to the basement to lift weights. She then becomes obsessed with body building. Marge starts entering contests and her disposition changes as she gets stronger. Blackboard reads 'This school does not need a "regime change"'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x10: Pray Anything
remaining.description: Jealous of Ned Flanders winning money at a sports event, Homer starts praying to God for good things to happen then develops a hedonistic lifestyle. Blackboard reads 'Spongebob is not a contraceptive'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x11: Barting Over
remaining.description: While doing spring cleaning, Lisa comes across a video cassette of a add Bart did as baby "Stink Breath". Bart gets so mad about Homer having spent his earnings from the add that he asks the court to emancipate him from the family. Blackboard reads 'I will not'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x12: I'm Spelling As Fast As I Can
remaining.description: Spelling champ Lisa makes the Spellympics, where host George Plimpton proposes a deal; Homer joins a traveling fan club for a new Krusty food product.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x13: A Star is Born Again
remaining.description: Ned becomes lonely when all the Springfield family's spend a day at the beach with their significant others and ends up dating an actor.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x14: Mr. Spritz Goes to Washington
remaining.description: Hoping to reroute air traffic over their house, the Simpsons ask Krusty to run for Congress, where the successful clown finds more of his kind.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x15: C. E. D'oh
remaining.description: Homer's stint in a success workshop gives him new initiative, but Mr. Burns' lack of appreciation prompts Homer to plot revenge, which results in a takeover of the power plant.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x16: 'Scuse Me While I Miss the Sky
remaining.description: Lisa searches for a steady career after a British filmmaker makes her feel inadequate and decides on astronomy.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x17: Three Gays of the Condo
remaining.description: While looking for a puzzle piece, Homer comes across a letter Marge wrote about how upset she was with Homer right before they were married. He thinks she married him because she became pregnant with Bart and moves out.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x18: Dude, Where's My Ranch?
remaining.description: Musician David Byrne offers to produce the song that Homer wrote about how much he dislikes his neighbor Ned Flanders. The Simpsons then go to a Dude Ranch where Lisa meets a special boy.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x19: Old Yeller-Belly
remaining.description: When Homer is trapped, the dog ignores him and he is saved by the cat. Homer then says he has no dog. H.K. Duff, owner of Duff beer makes the Simpsons dog, Santa's Little Helper the Duff mascot. Blackboard reads 'my pen is not a booger launcher'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x20: Brake My Wife, Please
remaining.description: Homer has his drivers license revoked by Judge Harm which forces Marge to do all the driving for the family.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x21: The Bart of War
remaining.description: Busted for a prank gone awry, Milhouse and Bart are enrolled in different youth groups that become heated rivals. Blackboard reads 'sandwiches should not contain sand'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 14x22: Moe Baby Blues
remaining.description: Homer and Marge permit Moe to baby sit Maggie and she takes a shine to Moe, which causes Homer to become jealous.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x01: Treehouse of Horror XIV
remaining.description: A Halloween trilogy (XIV), with Jennifer Garner, Oscar De La Hoya and Jerry Lewis as Professor Frink's father, who goes on a rampage after being brought back from the dead. Homer kills death in the first tale and has to become the grim reaper; In the Second tale Professor Frink wins a Nobel prize and then brings his father back from the dead in a Frankenstein parody; in the 3rd tale Bart gets access to a watch that changes the fabric of existence and along with Milhouse they cause trouble in Springfield.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x02: My Mother the Carjacker
remaining.description: Surfacing to see her son, Homer's fugitive mom is caught and tried for sabotaging a lab owned by Mr. Burns, who's loath to let a grudge die.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x03: The President Wore Pearls
remaining.description: Lisa is made to look like Eva Peron in this loose parody as faculty members undermine her student-body presidency.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x04: The Regina Monologues
remaining.description: Prime Minister Tony Blair welcomes the Simpsons to England, where they run into author J.K. Rowling and actor Ian McKellan.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x05: The Fat and the Furriest
remaining.description: Homer goes on a mission of revenge against a bear that attacked him during a visit to the dump and creates a home made bear-fighting suit. Blackboard 'My pen is not a booger launcher'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x06: Today I Am a Klown
remaining.description: Krusty's rabbi father helps him prepare for his bar mitzvah, which includes Mr. T; Homer guest hosts for Krusty and is a hit. Dan Castellaneta, Blackboard reads 'over forty & single is not funny'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x07: 'Tis the Fifteenth Season
remaining.description: A version of "A Christmas Carol" causes Homer to go from greedy to giving, prompting jealousy in Flanders, who gives gifts to everyone in town.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x08: Marge vs. Singles, Seniors, Childless Couples and Teens, and Gays
remaining.description: Maggie is among the babies who riot at a kiddie concert, prompting a backlash by single childless citizens, who organize against kids and families.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x09: I, (Annoyed Grunt)-Bot
remaining.description: Unable to build Bart a working robot for TV's "Robot Rumble," Homer becomes the robot by hiding inside, taking beatings, but giving better.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x10: Diatribe of a Mad Housewife
remaining.description: Tom Clancy, Thomas Pynchon and the Olsen twins have cameos as Marge writes a novel that casts Homer in a bad light, and Flanders in a good one.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x11: Margical History Tour
remaining.description: Marge talks history, with Homer as Henry VIII, Lenny and Carl as Lewis and Clark, Lisa as an opinionated Sacagawea and Bart as Mozart.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x12: Milhouse Doesn't Live Here Anymore
remaining.description: Bart bonds with Lisa after Milhouse and his mom move to Capital City; Homer panhandles to buy Marge's anniversary gift.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x13: Smart & Smarter
remaining.description: Simon Cowell plays an admissions interviewer at a prestigious pre-nursery school where Maggie's IQ is found to surpass Lisa's, causing an identity crisis for the older sister.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x14: The Ziff Who Came to Dinner
remaining.description: Lisa finds Arte Ziff living in their attic after seeing a horror movie with Homer and Bart. Artie moves in because he owes massive amounts of money to his company shareholders. Blackboard reads 'I will not speculate on how hot teacher used to be'.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x15: Co-Dependent's Day
remaining.description: After a winery tour, Marge and Homer become drinking pals, until a driving mishap prompts one to pull a fast one on the other.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x16: Wandering Juvie
remaining.description: Sarah Michelle Gellar plays a delinquent whom Bart meets in a juvenile-correction facility that's not strong enough to hold them.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x17: My Big Fat Geek Wedding
remaining.description: Skinner's cold feet near the altar also give Edna second thoughts, leading her into a rebound romance.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x18: Catch 'Em If You Can
remaining.description: Grandpa, Bart and Lisa Simpson take off on a cross country journey when Homer and Marge just want to spend a bit of kid free time.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x19: Simple Simpson
remaining.description: Avenging a slight to Lisa turns Homer into the city's new crusader for justice, a masked man whose weapon of choice is a pie in the face.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x20: The Way We Weren't
remaining.description: After Bart and Milhouse play a game of Spin the Bottle in the tree house, Homer tells the story of his and Marge's first kiss. Marge and Homer then learn they were destined to be together.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x21: Bart-Mangled Banner
remaining.description: Marge and Homer work hard to get Bart to the doctor for a shot, he then goes deaf as a side effect. Later he is bending over doing a full moon and accidentally moons the American Flag and the Dante basket ball classic during the national anthem.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 15x22: Fraudcast News
remaining.description: Mr. Burns buys all the media outlets in town after everyone thinks he is dead and does not care. Lisa starts her own newspaper and ends up in a war with Burns.

remaining.title: The Simpsons 16x01: Treehouse of Horror XV
remaining.description: Hands out its annual Halloween treats on the "Treehouse of Horror XV" special featuring three deliciously frightful mini-episodes.
